column4: Then it would work, except that it allowed only 320x240 or 640x480 screenmodes
Guess that if it can't figure out working settings, it assumes the worse
Rather than potentially damage a monitor
Added vendor & model names aswell, although they probably aren't needed
you might find /var/log/Xorg.0.log helpfull as well to see what Xorg picks up and defaults back to
Well it works for me now
Was just explaining what kind of problem I had, in case it was related with what Twister has
ok, may been pointed at Twister, got mixed up :)
I just have this sort copy problem :)
sort copy ? what are you trying to achieve ?
Alphabetically sorted filelist on a device, which doesn't sort directories
i see .. what about redirecting the output to a tmp file and sorting it with "sort' command ?
Well I got as far as getting file list with find, then sorted it with sort
ok, is that's not a viable option for you doing it likie that ? can't say i immediately have better solutions
Well the problem was what to do with sorted list which contains both directories and files
But I think I figured out a solution now
ok, can be complex allright, takes a clear head and time (pressed for both a bit at the moment lol)
And I think it's a better idea to live with it, rather than starting to modify the viewer program to sort directories :)
